indicator.title: Output Indicator

baseline.comment: (1) 0 (2) 0 (3) Less than 2.5% (4) No mechanism established to increase staff capacity: staff capacity as measured by UNDP Capacity Scorecard is at 52% at baseline (2010)

target.comment: (1) At least 10 biodiversity-based products developed by pilot social enterprises (2) Available: biodiversity-based promotional mark launched (3) 4% (4) Partially: staff capacity increase 20% against the baseline.

actual.comment: (1) 12 (2) Launch of BEDO promotional mark (3) 4% (4) Largely: staff capacity increased to 56% against the baseline. 12 courses conducted; (as of December 2014 – at midterm review point)

target.comment: (1) 15 with 8 certified as sustainable (2) Promotional mark operated with increased number of products endorsed (3) 5% (4) Increased training courses of Bio-academy; BEDO’s staff capacity increased to 70% against the baseline at the end of project (December 2015)

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: (1) Availability of technical tools developed to mainstream Climate Change into sectoral development planning and budgeting (2) Number of budget requests from sectoral agencies incorporating climate change analysis formulated and submitted to the Bureau of Budget (3) Availability of the common framework for Climate Change analysis at the project and programme level to be integrated as criteria for the Bureau of Budget’s consideration for budget appropriation (4) Availability of options for inter-agency coordination and institutional arrangements for climate finance

baseline.comment: (1) 0 (2) 0 (3) Climate Public Expenditures and Institutional Review (CPEIR) completed in 2012 but recommendations not yet developed into a common framework for budget requests and appropriation (4) No inter-agency coordination and institutional arrangement mechanism for climate finance

target.comment: (1) Benefit-Cost Analysis (BCA) quantifying additional benefits of climate change piloted at the project / programme level to mainstream Climate Change into planning and budgeting under Ministry of Agriculture (2) 4 Case studies developed with key agencies under Ministry of Agriculture to serve as preliminary drafts for budget proposal with climate change benefit analysis (3) A draft common framework to integrate climate change analysis into budget request and appropriation developed (4) Proposed options for inter-agency coordination and institutional arrangements for climate finance developed and discussed

actual.comment: (1) Benefit-Cost Analysis (BCA) quantifying additional benefits of climate change successfully developed and applied to five key projects under Ministry of Agriculture with an aim to mainstream Climate Change into planning and budgeting (2) 2 case studies completed (under Royal Irrigation Department and Land Development Department) (3) Completion with the draft common framework with stakeholders’ consultation (4) Proposed options for inter-agency coordination and institutional arrangements for climate finance, namely the Sub-Committee on Climate Finance under the National Committee on Climate Change chaired by Prime Minister developed and discussed

target.comment: (1) Cost-effectiveness assessment for mitigation actions developed and tested with the Energy Conservation Fund projects to provide guideline in climate change analysis for mitigation actions under Ministry of Energy (2) 2 budget requests incorporating climate change benefit analysis formulated by two key departments under Ministry of Agriculture and submitted to the Bureau of Budget (3) Guidelines for Climate Change Benefit Analysis developed and discussed among sectoral, policy and planning, and budget agencies (4) Recommendation on inter-agency coordination and institutional arrangement for climate finance in Thailand endorsed by the National Climate Change Committee

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1) Availability of a comprehensive policy paper on GHG mitigation actions with identified baseline scenarios and priority areas to support policy decision making and Thailand’s positioning in UNFCCC negotiation 2) Availability of Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDC) document to support Thailand’s position in UNFCCC negotiation 3) Number of capacity building/ consultation organized for related line agencies to enable understanding and participation in the development of Thailand’s Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDC)

baseline.comment: 1) No comprehensive policy paper on GHG mitigation actions with identified baseline scenarios and priority areas to support policy decision making and Thailand’s positioning in UNFCCC negotiation 2) No Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDC) document to support Thailand’s position in UNFCCC negotiation 3) No capacity building/ consultation organized for related line agencies to enable understanding and participation in the development of Thailand’s Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDC)

actual.comment: 1) Baseline scenarios and priority areas endorsed among key related agencies (climate change, energy, and transport agencies) 2) Zero draft INDC document developed 3) 4

target.comment: 1) The comprehensive policy paper on GHG mitigation actions with identified baseline scenarios and priority areas endorsed by the National Climate Change Committee 2) Submission of Thailand’s Intended Nationally Determined Contributions Document to the UNFCCC before the Conference of Parties 21 in Paris 3) 10

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1) Number of common space for peace platform in place to raise civic awareness 2) Number of pilot alternative dispute resolution (ADR) mechanism models developed 3) Number of vulnerable groups/communities benefiting from small grants projects

baseline.comment: 1) Lack of awareness and common strategic roles/position in peace process and participation of CSO, peace network and local people. 2) Zero alternative dispute resolution (ADR) mechanisms in place for effective legal services and quality legal protection 3) Zero small grant projects supported for resilience regarding participation, employment and livelihood.

target.comment: Project formulation and inception workshop conducted

actual.comment: Project formulation and inception workshop conducted in December 2014

target.comment: 1) 3 peace platforms organised for target groups 2) Alternative dispute resolution (ADR) mechanisms in place in Pattani 3) At least 5 small grants projects implemented and administered

iati-activity.title: MADRiD Project
iati-activity.description: A national development processes enhanced towards climate resilience and environmental sustainability

iati-activity.title: MADRiD Project
iati-activity.description: The project is to integrate Climate change adaptation and disaster risk reduction mainstreamed by key line ministries into their sectorial and provincial plans, policies and budgets.

iati-activity.title: 2015 Advancing Anti-corruption Efforts in Thailand
iati-activity.description: Advancing Anti-corruption Efforts in Thailand - A Multifaceted Approach (AAA) Project.

iati-activity.title: 2015 Advancing Anti-corruption
iati-activity.description: This project combines a number of initiatives, including mitigating corruption risks in public procurement; youth empowerment and integrity education; and social entrepreneurship and social innovations in the fight against corruption.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
Indicators for Output 1 1.1 Number of legal and operational guidance documents for the new Public Procurement Law drafted 1.2 Number of strategy and roadmap for building an efficient institutional structure for the new Public Procurement Law developed and adopted 1.3 Number of national public procurement training and professionalisation strategy developed
Indicators for output 2 Output 2.1 • Number of “Refuse To Be Corrupt” cafés established • Number of students’ anti-corruption activities funded by proceeds from “Refuse To Be Corrupt” café
Output 2.2 • Number of “Refuse To Be Corrupt” student clubs are established and active
Output 3 • Number of Integrity and Anti-Corruption Education Centre of Thailand (I-ACT) established
